teachers.title: Gifted Resource Teacher
teachers.bio: My philosophy towards gifted education is simple. If you come to me for something I will help you, punto final, as we say in our family. Want to find a summer program? Interested in taking an online Chinese class? Wondering about a college that can teach you about organic farming and philosophy? I am game. Do you want to do an Independent Study on the History of Jazz? Let's do it. Want to start a club here at school? You got it. Want to change something in our community for the better? Giddy up. Anyone who wants to challenge themselves, learn something new, take on the world, jump off that cliff is gifted in my book. Punto. Final.
teachers.activities: Independent Study, Reframing the Narrative, Model United Nations, Multicultural Club
teachers.interests: Equity and Justice, Travel, Cooking, Reading, Spending time with family

teachers.title: English Teacher
teachers.bio: My name is Miss Akers and this will be my fifth year teaching at WAHS.

teachers.title: Coordinator of The Learning Center
teachers.subjectsTaught: Formerly, I taught English, Core Plus, and Study Skills.
teachers.bio: Born in C'ville, I am one of those people who keeps coming back. I left for most of my childhood, returned for high school, left for college, returned to continue my education, left to work in another city, and returned (for good . . . maybe!) in 2001.  My husband Jeff and I have two grown children whom we love to visit in RVA and Philly. We also have a beagle, Baxter, and an elderly and somewhat crotchety cat, Lucy.  I have been in education for 30 years and am thrilled to be coordinating the all-new TLC this year!
teachers.activities: Reading! Walking with Jeff and Baxter! Watching movies and really great TV shows! Cooking! Rearranging and redecorating our house! Traveling!
teachers.interests: History, especially WWII and the Holocaust; learning about other cultures; studying languages; getting to know people

teachers.title: Mathematics Instructor
teachers.subjectsTaught: A.F.T.A. / AP Calculus AB / Honors Algebra II
teachers.bio: I have been a teacher for nearly 30 years. This is my 18th year in Albemarle County and 8th at Western. Over the years I worked at The Blue Ridge School, PVCC, Walton Middle School and Monticello High School. The courses I have taught range from Practical 6th Grade Math up to Calculus BC. I was also an Instructor at PVCC and taught Statistics and Applied Calculus.

teachers.title: Physics Teacher
teachers.levelsTaught: Advanced, Honors, AP Phys 1, AP Phys C
teachers.bio: I greatly enjoy teaching physics and working with high school students to support their life journeys to success! I have a B.S. in Applied Physics and a secondary science teaching certification, both from the University of Wisconsin - River Falls. I'm excited to be a part of the team at Western Albemarle and join all the amazing staff and students - go Warriors!

teachers.title: Teacher
teachers.bio: Hello! My name is Kate Innes and I teach AP Economics and World History I here at Western Albemarle. I've been teaching for over 20 years and I've been at WAHS since 2011. I have a BS from the University of Evansville and a MA in Education from Webster University. I serve on the Leadership Council as the chair of the Staff Development focus group and I'm a member of our schools AVID site team.
teachers.activities: reading, horses and horseback riding, spending time with my family, and being a quasi craft queen

teachers.title: Social Studies Teacher
teachers.subjectsTaught: American Studies - US History and Leadership
teachers.bio: I have been a history lover since I was born. My main interests are social and material culture history. This year I am very excited that windows have been added to our American Studies classrooms. We will now be able to see our beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains.
